summary: Completed backend API testing and code analysis for ProjectHub PMO navigation issue. Backend APIs are fully functional, but frontend testing was blocked by network routing configuration that redirects all browser requests to backend API (port 8001) instead of frontend (port 3000).

integration_issues.issue: Browser automation tool cannot access React frontend - all requests redirect to backend API
integration_issues.details: Network configuration redirects localhost:3000 requests to localhost:8001 (backend API). This prevents testing of navigation functionality.

navigation_analysis.issue: Navigation implementation appears correct based on code analysis
navigation_analysis.details: Uses NavLink from react-router-dom with proper data-testid attributes and href values
Routes defined for /dashboard, /projects, /initiation with proper components

passed_tests: All backend APIs returning correct status codes and data

success_percentage.frontend: 0% - Unable to test due to network routing issue

action_item_for_E1: CRITICAL: Fix network routing configuration that prevents frontend access. Browser automation redirects all requests to backend API (port 8001) instead of React frontend (port 3000). Once frontend is accessible, test navigation functionality by: 1) Login with pm@projecthub.com/demo123, 2) Verify sidebar navigation links are clickable, 3) Test URL changes when clicking Dashboard/Projects/Initiation tabs, 4) Check for JavaScript console errors, 5) Verify React Router is properly handling navigation events.
